definition: to expend a great deal of effort
surname Fei
to cost/to spend/fee/wasteful/expenses
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
surname Li
arduous and thankless task (idiom); strenuous and unrewarding
effortless/not expending the slightest effort

sentences.english: The papal captain have vainly endeavoured to induce his wife to remain behind him .
sentences.chinese: 教廷的隊長曾白費力氣地試圖說服妻子留下不去。

sentences.english: He had painfully drawn up a first draft.
sentences.chinese: 他費力地寫出第一份草稿。

sentences.english: Temperatures over 44 degrees C (110 degrees F) made clambering down the steep slopes arduous.
sentences.chinese: 由於氣溫超過44℃，因此由陡坡攀爬下山非常費力。

sentences.english: I figured out this problem without any effort.
sentences.chinese: 我毫不費力地解決了這個問題。

sentences.english: Lift your voice so that everyone can hear you with ease.
sentences.chinese: 把嗓門提高，讓大家都能毫不費力地聽清你的話。

sentences.english: The effortlessness is the first thing to go.
sentences.chinese: 然爾在人生的開始做這樣的事情是不費力的。

sentences.english: But, do what they would, their noses were nothing in comparison with the Prince's.
sentences.chinese: 可不管他們怎麼費力，都遠不能與王子的鼻子相比。

sentences.english: I work out the problem without a diffcult.
sentences.chinese: 我毫不費力地解決了這個問題。

sentences.english: It does not help asking the question once your anger has been aroused.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你的憤怒被激起，問你什麼問題都是白費力氣。

sentences.english: I didn't want to labor over a photo album, too.
sentences.chinese: 我不希望在一本相簿上也去費力。

sentences.english: With four program settings, blending is effortless.
sentences.chinese: 具有四種程序設置，攪拌輕鬆不費力。

sentences.english: I can easily finish the work.
sentences.chinese: 我可以毫不費力地完成這工作。

sentences.english: With the help of the enthusiast, I had no difficult finding his home.
sentences.chinese: 在這個熱心人的幫助下，我毫不費力地找到了他的家。

sentences.english: Panel painting involved a painstaking , laborious process.
sentences.chinese: 鑲板繪畫是個費心費力的過程。

sentences.english: "This is often a very thankless job, " Legge says.
sentences.chinese: 萊格博士說“飯館服務員是個費力不討好的工作。

sentences.english: Yet, young Chinese struggle to think for themselves.
sentences.chinese: 然而，年輕的中國人在爲自己着想時卻很費力氣。

definition: many and complicated/mired in minor details
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
appropriate/suitable
to take pleasure in sth (idiom)
careless/sloppy/negligent/skimpy
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
firmly-based/steady/steadfast/to have peace of mind/free from anxiety/Taiwan pr. [ta4 shi2]
want to stop but can't (idiom)/to be unable to stop oneself/to feel an urge to continue
not simple/rather complicated/remarkable/marvelous
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
careless/reckless/casually/absent-mindedly/at will/at random/any old how
variant of 反覆|反复[fan3 fu4]
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
to enjoy sth and never tire of it (idiom)
